docs.lead_paragraph: ON steamy summer days in the nation's capital, commuters on their bicycles toil up the long hill from Embassy Row, past the Vice President's mansion and to the heights where the National Cathedral towers over the city and its nearby suburbs. It is a popular route for people who work downtown, and one that I have pedaled hundreds of times over the years, six miles each way between home and office. Thanks to the rolling terrain, the pavement manages to slope uphill in both directions.

headline.main: For Bicyclists Who Welcome A Little Help (Mostly Uphill)

docs.abstract: Article assesses two bicycles equipped with battery-powered assistor motors: the EV Warrior from Electric Bicycle Co and mountain bike from Zap Power Systems; photos (M)
